definitions.definition: operated by power from an engine

examples.text: The breakdown was due to a mechanical failure.

definitions.definition: done without thinking, like a machine

examples.text: My work has become mechanical—I could do it in my sleep.

definitions.definition: connected with the physical laws of movement and cause and effect (= with mechanics)
good at understanding how machines work

wordOrigin: late Middle English (describing an art or occupation concerned with the construction of machines): via Latin from Greek mēkhanikos (from mēkhanē, from mēkhos ‘contrivance’) + -al.
